stories.title: The Google Weather Frog no longer wears a mask

stories.text:
It seems we're now stuck with the term "Technical Debt" to describe things needing cleanup. Non-technical people need a number we can use to express just how expensive putting off cleanup will be to make rational decisions we can all live with.

What is your personal estimate of the interest rate we pay on technical debt?

Also, what units is the denominator in the fraction? Is it code size, functionality, or just calendar time?
stories.title: Ask HN: What's the interest rate on technical debt?

stories.text: Couldn't someone with a cheap windows PC and a pair of monitors + misc. data feeds just replicate it for considerably less money? It costs $24k/year for a single subscription. At least with the PC you can install your own software. Bloomberg charging so much still for its services would be like Silicon Graphics still charging $30k for workstations when cheaper alternatives exist.
